isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS - MASTER DIAGNOSTICS (MD 32) - PROGRAMMABLE PARAMETERS, CHANGE / VIEW

svcproc.title: PROGRAMMABLE PARAMETERS, CHANGE / VIEW
svcproc.para: Select Vehicle then Program from the drop-down menu bar.
A generic Vehicle Programming window will appear .

step1.para: To add programmable parameters to this window, select Add/Delete/Edit Parameters.

Double click on a parameter from the Selected Parameters list box to remove it from the Vehicle Programming view window.
.
Place the mouse pointer in the Vehicle Programming window and right click to bring up advanced features.
Click the advanced features Refresh option .

svcproc.para: The current value information supplied by the ECM will be displayed to the desired parameters. You must enter a password to modify any parameters.

step1.para: Place the mouse pointer in the Vehicle Programming window and right click to bring up the advanced features. Click Enter Password to enter a password (The password must be between 4 and 8 alphanumeric characters.)

svcproc.para: The following screens illustrate three Edit Parameter displays normally encountered. The screens differ on what can be changed. After clicking OK, all parameters, which can be toggled ON / OFF or changed in a numerical range will display The parameter was programmed successfully .
The example shows a parameter value that can only be turned ON or OFF. After your selection click OK.
For those parameters that require numeric entries, enter the appropriate value in the New Valuebox, as long as the value is in the required range. Click OK when complete.
Some parameters can not be changed depending on application. These are read only parameters and provide no means for modification . Simply click OK to acknowledge.
To verify that a parameter was changed, right click to bring up the advanced features. Click the Refresh option. Master Diagnostics will request all the programmable parameters from the ECM.
